Posts.Content:
I am been following your thread exqualls and was upset to read your last post. You have been through so much...
I am sending you my prayers and well wishes for you to get well and leave this chapter in the rear view mirror. 
I hope you are recovering and feeling better. 
Hugs and prayers,

Posts.Content:
I am so glad you are on the mend exqualls! I have Crohn's disease and during one of my many stays in the hospital due to medication side effects or allergies , I had a hospitalist tell me that medication is nothing more than controlled poisoning of the body. I never forgot that. 
Please rest and get strong . We will be here praying for you.

Posts.Title: new to forum, diagnostic mammo and ultrasound found large lumps

Posts.Content:
Today is six days post skin saving double mastectomy with immediate reconstruction and I feel great. I was only at the hospital for seven hours. That includes waiting in the waiting room for an hour. I came home and have had pain from the expander tube sitting on the rib but everything else is good. Pathology was negative except for a bunch of other junk but no cancer. I get my sutures out next Monday and once all the swelling goes away and the Dr can make sure both sides are even, he will surgically remove the expander tube..
I feel like a cancer surviver even though I didn't have it. My breasts were a constant source of worry and stress that is finally gone.
Glad the worst is behind me:)
Dx:Ulcerative Colitis March 2008

Posts.Title: double mastectomy nipple sparing

Posts.Content: Gogirlysa, did you have your surgery?
Posts.Title: double mastectomy nipple sparing

Posts.Content:
Thanks Exqualls! 
I am still doing great. I am very happy with my breast results and every time I hear of someone that has been diagnosed with breast cancer, I -am very sad for them but breath a sigh of relief that I don't have as much of a worry anymore. I hope my story helps others of they are debating this surgery. 
If anyone has any doubts or questions, feel free to email me.
Posts.Title: double mastectomy nipple sparing

Posts.Content:
Hi all. I normally post on the crohns forum but I am scheduled for a prophylactic double mastectomy due to severe fibrocystic breast disease. I have hundreds of cysts in each breast combined with extremely dense breast tissue. My mammograms and ultrasounds always list as multiple masses believed to be cysts which always worried me. I have had plenty of aspirations of cysts over the years and recently had a core biopsy on an area that was also just a cyst. My mother died of breast cancer and since I never knew my grandmother or her medical history, I don't know who else in my family may have had breast cancer also. 
To be honest, I am tired of the constant worry about
 if or when they will find something that is not a cyst. 
I am going with a nipple/skin saving double mastectomy with immediate reconstruction. I have large breasts now but want to go small. I am 50 and would love not to always have to wear a bra! 
I am concerned about
 pain and not being able to pick myself up out of a bathtub. I am very independent and don't want to have to rely on my hubby to help me do everything. How long will it be before I should be able to function on my own?

Posts.Title: double mastectomy nipple sparing

Posts.Content:
Gogirlusa, I am sorry I am just reading your post! I am going to try to email you to see how you are doing. 
My update, I am still doing great. My surgery to remove the expander tubes was pushed back due to insurance reasons but it should happen within the next month. I am going to let him change out my implants to the high profile and also have a tummy tuck at the same time. Why not, right?! 
Take care everyone!
Posts.Title: double mastectomy nipple sparing

Posts.Content:
Update. My recovery has been a piece of cake. My reconstructed breasts are beautiful and much better than I used to have. I will have surgery to remove the expander tube next month and during that surgery, my plastic surgeon offered to change my implants to the "high profile" if I want. Still debating that. 
I am so relieved to have my old breasts gone and hope I have managed to out-wit any breast cancer . If anyone is considering this surgery, find a good plastic surgeon and just do it!
